abstract: The move, which came after antitrust regulators raised objections, leaves Yahoo scrambling for a plan for growth.
snippet: The move, which came after antitrust regulators raised objections, leaves Yahoo scrambling for a plan for growth.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Google offered its rival Yahoo a marriage of convenience this past summer: an advertising partnership that gave Yahoo an alternative to selling all or part of itself to Microsoft.

headline.main: Google Won’t Pursue Yahoo Ad Deal
headline.print_headline: Google Out Of Ad Deal With Yahoo

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Steve Lohr

abstract: Yahoo‘s stock jumped as much as 10 percent on Wednesday morning as rumors flew that it was on the verge of reaching a deal with Microsoft. The rumors, which people close to both companies unequivocally say are not true, seemed to gain legs when a broker sent around this e-mail to dozens of hedge funds:
lead_paragraph: Yahoo‘s stock jumped as much as 10 percent on Wednesday morning as rumors flew that it was on the verge of reaching a deal with Microsoft. headline.main: Yahoo’s Stock Spurts on False Rumors

abstract: Yahoo has lost a year in its endless maneuvering with Microsoft and Google and is likely to lose months more as it ponders its next move.
snippet: Yahoo has lost a year in its endless maneuvering with Microsoft and Google and is likely to lose months more as it ponders its next move.
lead_paragraph: Like Microsoft before it, Google has now decided that Yahoo is not worth fighting for. Google said Wednesday that it would not challenge the Justice Department, which objected to its plan to sell some ads on behalf of Yahoo.

abstract: Is it possible to extract the content from a corrupted Microsoft Word 2003 file that won’t open?
